com.jjoe64.graphview

Class GridLabelRenderer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jjoe64.graphview.GridLabelRenderer

  • public class GridLabelRenderer
extends java.lang.Object
    The default renderer for the grid and the labels.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  GridLabelRenderer.GridStyle

      wrapper for the styles regarding to the grid and the labels

    • Method Detail

      • resetStyles

        public void resetStyles()
        resets the styles. This loads the style from reading the values of the current theme.

      • reloadStyles

        public void reloadStyles()
        will load the styles to the internal paint objects (color, text size, text align)

        the general text size for the axis titles

        Returns:
        the alignment of the text of the vertical labels

      • getHorizontalLabelsColor

        public int getHorizontalLabelsColor()
        Returns:
        the font color of the horizontal labels

      • invalidate

        public void invalidate(boolean keepLabelsSize,
                       boolean keepViewport)
        clears the internal cache and forces to redraw the grid and labels. Normally you should always call GraphView.onDataChanged(boolean, boolean) which will call this method.
        Parameters:
        keepLabelsSize - true if you don't want to recalculate the size of the labels. It is recommended to use "true" because this will improve performance and prevent a flickering.
        keepViewport - true if you don't want that the viewport will be recalculated. It is recommended to use "true" for performance.

      • adjustVerticalSecondScale

        protected boolean adjustVerticalSecondScale()
        calculates the vertical steps of the second scale. This will not do any automatically update of the bounds. Use always manual bounds for the second scale.
        Returns:
        true if it is ready

      • adjustVertical

        protected boolean adjustVertical()
        calculates the vertical steps. This will automatically change the bounds to nice human-readable min/max.
        Returns:
        true if it is ready

      • adjustHorizontal

        protected boolean adjustHorizontal()
        calculates the horizontal steps. This will automatically change the bounds to nice human-readable min/max.
        Returns:
        true if it is ready

      • adjust

        protected void adjust()
        adjusts the grid and labels to match to the data this will automatically change the bounds to nice human-readable values, except the bounds are manual.

      • humanRound

        protected double humanRound(double in,
                            boolean roundAlwaysUp)
        this will do rounding to generate nice human-readable bounds.
        Parameters:
        in - the raw value that is to be rounded
        roundAlwaysUp - true if it shall always round up (ceil)
        Returns:
        the rounded number
